feature1.explanation: Both texts contain varied punctuation marks such as hyphens, brackets, colons, commas, and parentheses. However, text 1 uses these punctuation marks more extensively and in a structured manner compared to text 2.

feature2.explanation: Text 1 demonstrates a more formal and structured language with specific political terminology and proper grammar. In contrast, text 2 exhibits a more casual and conversational tone with colloquial expressions and questions.

feature3.explanation: Text 1 is characterized by longer and more complex sentences discussing political scenarios. Text 2, in contrast, has shorter sentences with a focus on questions and suspicions.

feature4.explanation: Text 1 adopts a formal and informative narrative style related to politics. Text 2 conveys a more speculative and questioning tone, suggesting a different discourse style.

feature5.explanation: Both texts are free from spelling and typographical errors, indicating a similar level of attention to detail in writing.

overall.explanation: Considering the analysis of the individual features, the likelihood that the two texts were written by the same author is moderately low due to differing punctuation styles, language formality, sentence structures, and narrative tones. The absence of spelling errors is the only commonality in writing style.
